Prima stepwise selection su tutto il training

```{r}
?stepAIC
stepAIC()

glm2_beforebackstep_training <- glm(y~age + job + marital + education + default + balance + housing + loan + contact + pdays + day + month + campaign + previous, family = "binomial", data = training_set)

glm2_backstep_selection <- stepAIC(object = glm2_beforestep_training, direction = "backward", scope = c(upper = ~age + job + marital + education + default + balance + housing + loan + contact + day + month + campaign + pdays + previous, lower = ~1))

glm2_beforeforwardstep_training <- glm(y~1, family = "binomial", data = training_set)

glm2_forwardstep_selection <- stepAIC(object = glm2_beforeforwardstep_training, direction = "forward", scope = c(upper = ~age + job + marital + education + default + balance + housing + loan + contact + day + month + campaign + pdays + previous, lower = ~1))

```

Mi sembra che utilizzando una backward step toglie solo default e ha un AIC di 22000 circa.
con la forward che li aggiunge uno a uno il miglio AIC Ã¨ 22600 per un modello con y ~ month + contact + housing + campaign + job + previous + loan + marital + education + pdays + balance + age + day
